item.title: UFO sightings in Greece
item.description:
List of alleged UFO sightings within the nation of Greece ðŸ”—

This article catalogs alleged UFO sightings in Greece, spanning from ancient times to the modern era.

404 BC ðŸ”—

This section mentions a fiery pillar sighting near Athens during a stormy, moonless night in 404 BC.

1946 ðŸ”—

This section details the “Ghost rockets” phenomenon witnessed in Thessaloniki by British Army units. It mentions Prime Minister Konstantinos Tsaldaris reporting projectiles over Macedonia and Thessaloniki. Physicist Paul Santorini led a Greek government investigation that was later stopped after conferring with the U.S. Department of Defense.

1954 ðŸ”—

This section covers the “Great 1954 Greek UFO flap,” a period of numerous UFO sightings. Specific incidents include:

  • Vrisa, Lesvos: Residents reported a small, star-like object maneuvering over the village.
  • Anemotia, Lesvos: A large luminous object with a tail hovered over the village.
  • Stipsi, Lesvos: A cigar-shaped object was witnessed by a boy and his father.
  • Agios Georgios Nileias, Thessaly: A large luminous cigar-shaped object appeared.
  • Agiasos, Lesvos: Reports of a luminescent UFO hovering over the village.
  • Doxato: A bright tail moving in circles was observed.
  • Didymoteicho: Residents witnessed a UFO landing of two cigar-shaped objects.
  • Antimachia, Kos: A flying object emitting a blinding light was witnessed.
  • Rhodos: A disc was reported traveling at high speeds.
  • Moudros, Lemnos: A flying frying pan was reported.
  • Pyrgos, Peloponnese: Witnesses observed a blinding flash in the sky.
  • Alissos, Patras: A bright luminous object was witnessed by hunters.
  • Pagasetic Gulf, Volos: A silvery flying saucer was witnessed and exploded.
  • Komotini: A flying saucer was observed moving in circles.
  • Athens: A luminous UFO was traveling over Faliro and Athens.
  • Plagiari, Pella: A priest and residents witnessed a flying saucer.
  • Athens: A silvery object stood still in the air.
  • Halki: Farmers saw a bright object traveling at high speeds.
  • Titani: An elderly man claimed to see a small car-like object rolling on a field that then took off into the sky.

1955 ðŸ”—

This section mentions a sighting near Agrinio where a truck driver and hotel manager saw a luminous flying object overhead, causing the truck engine to stop.

1959 ðŸ”—

This section describes a strong flash of light and a loud bang observed over Kalymnos island, followed by a rocket-shaped object moving across the sky.

1968 ðŸ”—

This section details an automobile mechanic in Xiromero observing a bullet-like UFO hovering and moving vertically before traveling west.

1985 ðŸ”—

This section includes two sightings:

  • Komotini: Fishermen witnessed a dark, cigar-shaped object moving slowly and then stopping before traveling north.
  • Naxos, Lemnos, Corfu: Air traffic controllers at three locations reported a cigar-like object moving at extremely high speeds. Officials speculated it could be a spaceship or American laser tests.

1990 ðŸ”—

This section describes a UFO crash near Megaplatanos Fthiotida. Witnesses reported multiple UFOs, one of which crashed. The remaining UFOs allegedly landed and collected debris until sunrise. The Hellenic Air Force investigated, suggesting it might have been a Soviet satellite or plane. Metallic pieces were sent to the Space Research Institute in Brussels. Georg N. Pantoulas interviewed witnesses.
